info.title: Condition Record for Pricing in Sales
info.description: Consumers of this inbound service can create, read, update, and delete condition records inside condition record, validity of condition record, pricing scale, and condition supplement.

x-sap-shortText: Create, read, update, and delete condition records for pricing in Sales using this synchronous inbound service

Condition Record for Pricing in Sales

x-sap-extensible.description:
API can be extended by custom fields on the following business contexts (field usage for this API needs to be selected):
* Sales: Pricing Communication Head (SD_PRICECOMHEAD)
* Sales: Pricing Communication Item (SD_PRICECOMITEM)

[How to add an extension field to an API](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/ce819b8557194ae0aa180ba4ac6a04de.html)

get.summary: Reads all condition supplements in the system.
get.description: Reads all condition supplements for pricing in Sales.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates one or more condition supplements.
post.description: Creates one or more condition supplements for existing condition records, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number in the payload.

get.summary: Reads a specific condition supplement.
get.description: Reads a specific condition supplement for pricing in Sales, which the consumer specifies by passing condition record number and sequential number.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.description: Updates a specific condition supplement for pricing in Sales, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number and sequential number.

delete.description: Deletes a specific condition supplement for pricing in Sales, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number and sequential number.

get.summary: Reads validity of the condition record for a specific condition supplement.
get.description: Reads data about validity of the condition record for a specific condition supplement for pricing in Sales, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number and sequential number. Validity includes fields such as valid from and to dates, condition fields, and condition type.

parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

get.summary: Reads validity of all condition records in the system.
get.description: Reads validity of all condition records for pricing in Sales. Validity includes fields such as valid from and to dates, condition fields, and condition type.

parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: ConditionValidityEndDate
parameters.description: Validity end date of the condition record

get.summary: Reads the validity of a specific condition record.
get.description: Reads the validity of a specific condition record, which the consumer specifies by passing condition record number, valid-from date, and valid-to date. Validity includes fields such as valid from and to dates, condition fields, and condition type.

parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

parameters.name: ConditionValidityEndDate
parameters.description: Validity end date of the condition record

get.summary: Reads the condition record for a specific condition record validity period.
get.description: Reads the condition record data for a specific validity period of a specific condition record, which the consumer specifies by passing condition record number, valid-from date, and valid-to date.

parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

get.summary: Reads all pricing scales in the system.
get.description: Reads all pricing scales defined for condition records and condition supplements in Sales.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

post.summary: Creates one or more pricing scales.
post.description: Creates one or more pricing scales for existing condition records or condition supplements, which the consumer specifies by passing condition record number and sequential number in the payload.

parameters.name: ConditionScaleLine
parameters.description: Current number of the line scale

get.summary: Reads a specific pricing scale.
get.description: Reads a specific pricing scale which the consumer specifies by passing condition record number, sequential number, and scale line number.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.description: Updates a specific pricing scale which the consumer specifies by passing condition record number, sequential number, and scale line number.

delete.description: Deletes a specific pricing scale which the consumer specifies by passing condition record number, sequential number, and scale line number.

parameters.name: ConditionScaleLine
parameters.description: Current number of the line scale

get.summary: Reads the condition supplement for a specific condition supplement pricing scale.
get.description: Reads the condition record for a specific condition record pricing scale, which the consumer specifies by passing condition record number, sequential number, and scale line number.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

parameters.description: Current number of the line scale

get.description: Reads the condition record for a specific condition record pricing scales, which the consumer specifies by passing condition record number, sequential number, and scale line number.

post.summary: Creates one or more condition records.
post.description: Creates one or more condition records by using deep insert requests. This means that consumers must create a condition record together with validity of the condition record. Consumers do this by including the entity for condition record validity in the payload.

get.summary: Reads a specific condition record.
get.description: Reads a specific condition record for pricing in Sales, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.description: Updates a specific condition record for pricing in Sales, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number.

delete.description: Deletes a specific condition record, which the consumer specifies by passing the condition record number. When a condition record is deleted, its validity, pricing scales, and condition supplements are no longer valid in pricing.

parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.description:
Group multiple requests into a single request payload, see [Batch Requests](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=152).

*Please note that "Try it out" is not supported for this request.*

multipart/mixed;boundary=request-separat.example:
--request-separator
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET A_SlsPrcgCndnRecdSuplmnt HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json


--request-separator--

multipart/mixed.example:
--response-separator
Content-Type: application/http

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{...}
--response-separator--

count.description: The number of entities in the collection. Available when using the [$inlinecount](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=67) query option.

innererror.description: The structure of this object is service-specific

top.name: $top
top.description: Show only the first n items, see [Paging - Top](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=66)

skip.name: $skip
skip.description: Skip the first n items, see [Paging - Skip](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)
